intro: Rothmannia pulcherrima, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Rothmannia pulcherrima is cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular in gardens and as a potted plant.
